docs.lead_paragraph: Are patients blabbermouths? Many doctors apparently think so. Research has shown that doctors interrupt, on average, about 20 seconds after a patient begins to talk.
docs.abstract: Study led by Dr Wolf Langewitz of Sweden, published in British Medical Assn journal, finds that while many doctors think their patients take too long to describe their complaints, average time was 92 seconds and 78 percent finished within two minutes; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: Are patients blabbermouths? Many doctors apparently think so.    Research has shown that doctors interrupt, on average, about 20 seconds after a patient begins to talk.
